MiniMeTokenFactory

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (contract MiniMeTokenFactory,contract MiniMeToken,uint256,string memory,uint8,string memory,bool) returns (contract MiniMeToken)

nodes.name: createCloneToken

allowance(address,address).details: This function makes it easy to read the `allowed[]` map

params._owner: The address of the account that owns the token
params._spender: The address of the account able to transfer the tokens

allowance(address,address).return: Amount of remaining tokens of _owner that _spender is allowed  to spend

params._amount: The amount of tokens to be approved for transfer
params._spender: The address of the account able to transfer the tokens

approve(address,uint256).return: True if the approval was successful

params._amount: The amount of tokens to be approved for transfer
params._spender: The address of the contract able to transfer the tokens

approveAndCall(address,uint256,bytes).return: True if the function call was successful

params._owner: The address that's balance is being requested

balanceOf(address).return: The balance of `_owner` at the current block

balanceOfAt(address,uint256).details: Queries the balance of `_owner` at a specific `_blockNumber`

params._blockNumber: The block number when the balance is queried
params._owner: The address from which the balance will be retrieved

params._newController: The new controller of the contract

params._token: The address of the token contract that you want to recover  set to 0 in case you want to extract ether.

params._cloneDecimalUnits: Number of decimals of the smallest unit
params._snapshotBlock: Block when the distribution of the parent token is  copied to set the initial distribution of the new clone token;  if the block is zero than the actual block, the current block is used
params._transfersEnabled: True if transfers are allowed in the clone

createCloneToken(string,uint8,string,uin.return: The address of the new MiniMeToken Contract

params._amount: The quantity of tokens to burn
params._owner: The address that will lose the tokens

destroyTokens(address,uint256).return: True if the tokens are burned correctly

params._transfersEnabled: True if transfers are allowed in the clone

params._owner: The address that will be assigned the new tokens

generateTokens(address,uint256).return: True if the tokens are generated correctly

totalSupply().details: This function makes it easy to get the total number of tokens

params._blockNumber: The block number when the totalSupply is queried

totalSupplyAt(uint256).return: The total amount of tokens at `_blockNumber`

params._amount: The amount of tokens to be transferred

transfer(address,uint256).return: Whether the transfer was successful or not

params._amount: The amount of tokens to be transferred
params._from: The address holding the tokens being transferred

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).return: True if the transfer was successful

approve(address,uint256).notice: `msg.sender` approves `_spender` to spend `_amount` tokens on  its behalf. This is a modified version of the ERC20 approve function  to be a little bit safer

approveAndCall(address,uint256,bytes).notice: `msg.sender` approves `_spender` to send `_amount` tokens on  its behalf, and then a function is triggered in the contract that is  being approved, `_spender`. This allows users to use their tokens to  interact with contracts in one function call instead of two

changeController(address).notice: Changes the controller of the contract

claimTokens(address).notice: ///////This method can be used by the controller to extract mistakenly  sent tokens to this contract.

createCloneToken(string,uint8,string,uin.notice: /////////////Creates a new clone token with the initial distribution being  this token at `_snapshotBlock`

enableTransfers(bool).notice: /////////////Enables token holders to transfer their tokens freely if true

totalSupplyAt(uint256).notice: Total amount of tokens at a specific `_blockNumber`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: Send `_amount` tokens to `_to` from `_from` on the condition it  is approved by `_from`
